data.title: Why in ios, it still Landscape?
Adjust NinePatch texture coordinates to avoid bleeding linear-blended atlas
data.body: Builds and tested in production. We've been using this change for months to allow us to use GL_LINEAR filtering on our UI atlas so that scaled sprites look nicer.

data.title: Remove duplicate code
data.body:
The createSprite(), createPatch() and findRegion() methods had a lot of identical code
 that could be simplified

data.title: Scaling Glitch in RoboVM Backend
data.body:
I noticed graphical glitches when rescaling a TextureRegion frequently (in a loop, animation). A static scaled image doesn't have this glitch, only in an animation. 

I can be fixed by making the TextureRegion bounds smaller by 1 pixel, but this solution is not ideal. 
It seems to pick a pixel row/column from the image to the left, right, top or bottom of the desired image in a spritesheet. It somehow seems to go out of the TextureRegion bounds shortly. 
I double checked the spritesheet to make sure that wasn't the problem. The Android version uses the same spritesheet images and doesn't show these glitches.

Tested on iPad simulator and on a real device (iPad Air).

data.title: Array length can't be more than Integer.MAX_VALUE
Added UDP datagram support to Gdx.Net
data.body:
This adds the ability to use UDP in Gdx.Net making it slightly easier to write UDP networking code while working with libgdx.

This allows sending and recieving data with UDP datagrams on all platforms, excluding GWT. I'm not sure if GWT will be supported in the future, but I am looking into a solution. This creates a new type of socket because the class used for TCP sockets were incompatible, or well at least without a hacky solution.

data.title: TextField cleanup
data.body:
- Added few new methods
- Removed unused fields and code-duplicate

getDefaultInputListener - returns a "inputListener" field. I've added this here because "clearListeners()" can beyond retrieve remove this listener.

data.title: Added support for arbitrary XML comments
data.body:
It is save to skip comment content up to the next '-->'. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/#syntax

See Issue #902

data.title: Ogg support for IOS devices (RoboVM Backend)
data.body:
Could ogg support be included in the IOS/RoboVM Backend? 
For a game that I'm porting from Android to IOS I need to be able to play ogg files (or convert them on runtime), because users can add their own files (including ogg files) to the game to generate a gameplay track. 
It's a rhythm game, so music is really important.

I found this page about precompiled ogg libraries, maybe it can be useful.
http://iosdeveloperzone.com/2012/08/07/precompiled-ogg-vorbis-libraries-for-ios/

data.title: Add missing Comparator import to TexturePacker2
Sort TexturePacker2 input files to avoid atlas changes across platforms
Filled Polygon rendering in ShapeRenderer
data.body: EarClippingTriangulator class was used to triangulate the polygon.

data.title: Path: add derivative
data.body: closes #891

data.title: FileHandle.exists isn't coherent on iOS
data.body:
It seems that by default libgdx fallbacks to the classpath for internal files, however, the exists() method is overridden in the IOSFileHandle class to only look at bare files.
This leads to situation where you can read() a file handle but its exists() method returns false.
Is this intended ? If not would it suffice to remove the override exists method or does it serves another purpose ?

Thanks by advance.

data.title: Make SpriteBatch extendable.
data.body: Minor changes in modifiers allow developers to write their own batch, using SpriteBatch as a foundation and, depending on the extent of modification, still be useable library-wide in place of a regular SpriteBatch.

data.title: Added allowIpod to IOSApplicationConfiguration
data.body:
Added a new variable to IOSAppConfig called allowIpod in order to be able to play the game without stopping the background music from iPod app.
Also, modified the constructor of IOSAudio to pass the IOSApplicationConfiguration from IOSApplication.

See:
http://badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=11544&p=51952
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/robovm/3YycMw9jOzE/j2mP2RDJ-CEJ

Also, the ObjectAL library should be updated in order for this to work, but I'm not sure how to do it.

data.title: TextureAtlas, fixed typo in previous commit
Android - Google US English keyboard backspace not working
data.body:
Android 4.3.1
Nexus 7 (2013)
When in a text field, backspace on the Google US English keyboard (I believe it's default for this device) does nothing. 
I wrote the below code in an InputProcessor to try to chase the bug, but it never even catches the backspace.

``` java
public boolean keyDown(int keycode) {
            Tools.log.debug("keyDown: " + keycode);
```

I switched to another keyboard and backspace was caught just fine.
Also verified google keyboard backspace works in other apps.

However, I'm not sure the problem is with libgdx.

data.title: getStage() return NULL.
Add setX and setY to TextureAtlas.AtlasSprite so that it matches expected whitespace behavior.
data.body: Currently the getters and setPosition have been overridden, but the setters still behave like normal sprites, which means the whitespace behavior of the AtlasSprite is screwed up when you use a setter. This fixes that.

data.title: Added Immersive Mode support for Android 4.4 Kit-kat devices
data.body: Android 4.4 added support for basically a slightly more advanced fullscreen feature called 'Immersive Mode'. This will be beneficial to some games that have support for smaller phones. This fixes #942

data.title: ArrayMap.entries() points to a single Entry
Clean up stream handling
data.body:
Some changes regarding stream handling:
- OggInputStream: close the underlying stream
- Ogg: close the OggInputStream stream
- StreamUtils: added copyStreamToByteArray  methods
- Wav: use StreamUtils.copyStreamToByteArray 
- NetJavaImpl: use StreamUtils.copyStreamToByteArray

data.title: Add key to the Info.plist.xml template for FullScreen
data.body:
Currently, this is the only key that's being added to the plist:

<key>UIStatusBarHidden</key>
<true />

In order for the fullscreen to works on iOS7, there's other key needed:

<key>UIViewControllerBasedStatusBarAppearance</key>
<false />

data.title: Update ArrayMap.java
